# Banking sector stability

Despite the COVID-19 pandemic bringing significant challenges to the economy, the Hong Kong banking sector remained resilient in 2020. Throughout the year, the HKMA closely monitored the impact of the pandemic on banking operations and regulatory activities, flexibly adapting to the situation, while continuing to focus its regulatory efforts on credit and liquidity risk management for authorized institutions. Given the continuous increase in cyber threats and the rising trend of fintech adoption in the banking industry, the HKMA strengthened supervision over technology risk management and operational soundness of authorized institutions. The HKMA also closely collaborated with banks and international organizations to facilitate the industry's transition to alternative reference rates.

In terms of conduct regulation, the HKMA provides authorized institutions with flexibility in handling regulatory compliance and offers guidance to assist banks in operating their business during the pandemic and to continue providing services to customers, while also ensuring continued protection for investors and consumers. The HKMA, together with relevant authorities, has developed the implementation details for the "Cross-border Wealth Management Connect" pilot program and consulted the industry. The HKMA collaborates with the Securities and Futures Ordinance (SFO) to provide guidance on simplifying sales procedures for family offices and high-net worth investors skilled in financial matters. Furthermore, the HKMA has strengthened protection for consumers of digital financial services and continues to promote a customer-centric corporate culture.

In combating money laundering and terrorist financing, the HKMA swiftly took action, not only clarifying how a risk-based approach and technology can assist authorized institutions in more effectively responding to situations related to the COVID-19 pandemic, but also prudently addressing the escalating geopolitical tensions' impact on the banking system. The HKMA continued to support measures aimed at enhancing the effectiveness and efficiency of efforts to combat money laundering and terrorist financing, including increasing the number of authorized institutions participating in public-private partnerships to share information, as well as supporting the banking industry in adopting compliance technology. The HKMA also aligned with the international development trends in technology and data utilization, launching further initiatives to strengthen the monitoring capabilities against money laundering and terrorist financing.

At the same time, the Hong Kong Monetary Authority (HKMA) closely cooperates with the banking industry to enhance regulatory policies and procedures, and implement measures to improve the professional capabilities of talent. Hong Kong has made ideal progress in implementing international regulatory standards, including capital adequacy standards and disclosure standards. In promoting the development of green and sustainable banking, the HKMA has entered the second phase of a three-phase plan and is currently formulating relevant regulatory measures. The HKMA continues to strive to ensure Hong Kong has a credible resolution mechanism for authorized institutions, including formulating new resolution standards and implementing rules for absorbing loss capacity, to enhance the resolvability of authorized institutions.

# Objective

One of the Hong Kong Monetary Authority's overall objectives is to promote the security and stability of the banking system. To achieve this objective, it relies on establishing and maintaining a financial system with high responsiveness and the ability to provide the essential financial services needed for Hong Kong's economy.

Banks may affect the stability of the banking system due to their operational methods, or even in extreme situations due to disorderly collapses. As regulatory authorities, the Financial Management Commissioner plays an important role in safeguarding financial stability, ensuring banks have the ability to withstand shocks, respond to crises, and resume normal operations after crises, ultimately helping prevent collapses. The Financial Management Commissioner is responsible for prudential supervision of banks, as well as authorizing licensed banks, restricted license banks, and deposit-taking companies in Hong Kong (collectively referred to as "authorized institutions"). The Financial Management Commissioner also oversees the designation and supervision of certain financial market infrastructures.

However, the Financial Services Oversight Council (FSOC) cannot ensure that the financial system is entirely free of risk, and Hong Kong's prudential regulatory regime is not designed to ensure 'zero risk'. As one of the resolution mechanism authorities, the FSOC strives to ensure that authorized institutions can be orderly resolved once they are no longer sustainable. To this end, Hong Kong has established a financial institution resolution mechanism, with the FSOC serving as the resolution mechanism authority for authorized institutions (and other types of institutions). To implement Hong Kong's resolution mechanism, it is necessary to formulate resolution rules and policy standards, conduct resolution planning to eliminate obstacles to the feasibility of resolving authorized institutions, and establish the Hong Kong Monetary Authority's operational capacity to resolve failing authorized institutions. To effectively carry out the aforementioned work, the Hong Kong Monetary Authority adopts a method consistent with and coordinated internationally.

# 2020 year review

# Regulatory Work Overview

The Monetary Authority conducted a total of 186 non-onsite reviews in 2020, covering a wide range of areas, including authorized institutions' CAMEL assessments, corporate governance, risk management, and fintech strategies. To continue strengthening the risk governance level of authorized institutions, the Monetary Authority held a total of 30 meetings with the authorized institutions' boards of directors, independent non-executive directors, or committees under the boards, and held 30 trilateral meetings with the authorized institutions and their external auditors.

In addition to off-site reviews, the HKMA also conducted regular on-site reviews and used thematic assessments as a complement to examine areas assessed as higher risk. The HKMA conducted a total of 610 on-site reviews and thematic assessments during the year, continuing to regard credit risk management as one of the main focuses of its reviews and assessments. Another key focus was on operational risks in business activities and technology risk management during the novel coronavirus pandemic. Furthermore, the HKMA increased the number of on-site reviews and thematic assessments on liquidity and market risk management. At the same time, specialized review groups also conducted on-site reviews and thematic assessments on securities, investment products, insurance, and MPF-related activities of authorized institutions.

Despite the pandemic, the HKMA maintains regulatory oversight and makes flexible arrangements, flexibly and effectively fulfilling its regulatory functions, including providing flexibility in submitting reports and conducting on-site reviews; strengthening data collection to supplement on-site reviews, as well as utilizing online meeting platforms.

Table 1 contains an outline of the HKMA's regulatory work in 2020.

Table 1 Regulatory Work Outline

# Credit Risk Regulatory

# Credit Growth and Asset Quality

In 2020, the total amount of loans increased by 1.2%, and the increase in 2019 was 6.7%. Table 2 provides the growth situation of various types of loans and advances.

Table 2 Loans and Advances Growth

In 2020, the Mainland-related total loan amount slightly decreased by 0.2% to 45,530 billion HK dollars (Table 3).

Table 3 Mainland-related loan growth

The asset quality of authorized institutions has slightly deteriorated due to the impact of the novel coronavirus pandemic. During the year, the specific classified loan ratio in the banking sector rose from 0.57% to 0.90%, still remaining at a sound level, far below the long-term average level of 1.8% since 2000. In terms of loans related to Mainland China, the relevant ratio also increased from 0.75% a year ago to 0.96%.

Given the significant challenges posed to the economy by uncertain factors related to the pandemic, the HKMA thoroughly reviewed the asset quality of authorized institutions to assess the deteriorating trend in asset quality. In particular, the HKMA strengthened oversight of large borrowers and sectors more vulnerable in the current economic environment by collecting data on credit risk exposure of banks at the industry and borrower levels. The special stress test analysis conducted by the HKMA showed that banks have the capacity to withstand the economic pressure brought about by the pandemic.

The HKMA conducted a special assessment to review the credit risk management methods of authorized institutions across different areas, including loans related to Mainland China, interbank loans, and secured loans to private banks and wealth management clients.

# Measures to relieve customers' funding turnover pressure

In response to the outbreak of the novel coronavirus pandemic, the Hong Kong Monetary Authority's Banking Sector SME Loan Coordination Mechanism (Coordination Mechanism), established in October 2019, launched multiple rounds of relief measures to assist enterprises and individual customers, encouraging banks to continue supporting borrowers' financing needs in line with prudent risk management principles. The main measure was the "Pre-approved Principal Payment Holiday" scheme introduced by the Coordination Mechanism in May. Under the scheme, all principal repayments for eligible enterprise customers could be deferred for six months. After being extended by six months in November, the scheme was further extended by six months in March 2021 until the end of October. Approximately 100 banks participated in the scheme, covering 120,000 eligible enterprise customers. As of the end of December, banks had approved over 58,000 cases of enterprise loan extensions and other support measures, involving an amount exceeding 740 billion HKD. Regarding individual customers, banks also introduced a residential mortgage "Principal Payment Holiday" scheme, with related mortgages under the Home Ownership Scheme also included. In addition, banks provided emergency loans to customers in industries severely impacted by the pandemic, extended personal loan terms, and reduced fees for various personal credit services. As of the end of December, banks had approved over 28,000 cases of residential mortgage "Principal Payment Holiday" and other personal emergency loans, involving an amount exceeding 44 billion HKD.

# Property Mortgage Loan

The Hong Kong Monetary Authority has launched multiple rounds of countercyclical macroprudential regulatory measures since 2009, which have strengthened risk management in banks and enhanced the resilience of the Hong Kong banking sector in coping with a sudden reversal in the local property market. The average loan-to-value ratio for newly issued residential mortgages was 57% in December 2020, compared to 64% in September 2009 before the first round of countercyclical measures was introduced. The average loan-to-value ratio for newly issued residential mortgages rose in 2020, primarily due to an increase in the proportion of loans involving mortgage insurance, which generally have higher loan-to-value ratios. The average debt-to-income ratio for newly issued mortgages also remained at a low level, at 37% in December 2020, compared to 41% in August 2010 when the ratio cap was first introduced (Chart 1).

Taking into account factors such as the price trends and transaction volume of non-residential properties, the economic outlook, and the external environment, the Hong Kong Monetary Authority relaxed the countercyclical macroprudential regulatory measures for non-residential property mortgages in August, increasing the applicable loan-to-value ratio cap for such loans by 10 percentage points. The cap for typical cases was raised from 40% to 50%.

Chart 1: Average Loan-to-Value Ratio and Repayment-to-Income Ratio of New Approved Residential Mortgage Loans

# Regulation of business operations and technology risks

In response to the outbreak of the novel coronavirus pandemic in early 2020, the Hong Kong Monetary Authority implemented a series of measures to minimize the impact of the pandemic on the operations of banking businesses. These measures included requiring authorized institutions to review their business continuity plans and take appropriate preventive measures to ensure the health of employees and customers, as well as to maintain essential banking services. Furthermore, the Hong Kong Monetary Authority reminded authorized institutions to enhance communication with employees and customers, prepare for potential confirmed cases in their premises, and develop business continuity plans to address more severe but potentially occurring risk scenarios. The Hong Kong Monetary Authority maintained close contact with the industry and urged authorized institutions to remain vigilant, regularly reviewing their business continuity plans in light of the latest developments of the pandemic and the government's social distancing measures.

The HKMA launched the Cybersecurity Fortification Initiative 2.0 in November after completing a comprehensive review and extensive industry consultation. It further enhances the Cybersecurity Fortification Initiative in response to the latest international practices for managing cyber risks. Among these, the Cybersecurity Fortification Assessment Framework incorporated the latest international robust practices regarding incident response and recovery. In terms of the Professional Training Programme under the Cybersecurity Fortification Initiative, the scope of the credentials certification list has been expanded to incorporate equivalent credentials from major overseas regions. The HKMA also proposed several recommendations to the Hong Kong Banking Association (Banking Association) to make the Cyber Risk Information Sharing Platform more user-friendly. The Cybersecurity Fortification Initiative 2.0 took effect on January 1, 2021.

# Smart Bank

After undergoing rigorous testing and trials in the "FinTech Regulatory Sandbox," all eight virtual banks that obtained banking licenses in 2019 have already commenced operations within the year. Virtual banks leverage innovative technology to provide customers with new experiences, such as using big data analysis for credit assessments of SME loans to expedite the loan approval process. To strengthen customer engagement and build customer loyalty to the brand, some virtual banks have incorporated game elements into their regular deposit and reward program services.

# Regulatory Oversight of Liquidity and Market Risk

The HKMA launched a series of measures in April to ensure the interbank market and banking sector continue to operate smoothly during the pandemic. These measures include clarifying the operational details of the "HKMA Liquidity Arrangement" and introducing a temporary USD liquidity arrangement, and reiterating the flexibility of authorized institutions to use liquidity buffers under the regulatory framework. The HKMA also conducted exercises with authorized institutions to ensure they are prepared to use these measures when needed.

# 香港的國際金融中心地位

香港繼續是具全球競爭力的國際金融中心。年內金管局採取多項措施，促進銀行及支付行業開發與應用金融科技。在新冠病毒疫情下年內快速支付系統「轉數快」交易量急增。

香港位處內地金融市場對外開放的要衝，能充分把握開放過程中的契機。憑藉世界級的市場基建以及「滬港通」、「深港通」與「債券通」，香港既是深受內地企業垂青的集資平台，亦是國際投資者進入增長迅速的內地市場的窗口。年內在促進粵港澳大灣區金融合作，尤其便利香港居民在大灣區內使用金融及銀行服務方面取得良好進展。

與此同時，金管局積極開拓新機遇，提升香港金融平台，包括資產及財富管理、企業財資中心，以及可持續金融範疇的競爭力。金管局亦加強市場推廣，向海外及內地持份者推廣香港的金融服務。在環球層面，金管局在多個區內及國際委員會擔當領導角色，充分凸顯香港在相關國際工作的專業知識及承擔。

# 概覽

為鞏固香港的亞洲金融科技樞紐地位，金管局繼續致力實施各項措施，促進銀行及支付行業開發與應用科技。年內的主要進展包括：
- 推動更廣泛使用快速支付系統「轉數快」；
- 促進銀行業實施開放應用程式介面（開放API）；
- 連接貿易融資平台「貿易聯動」與中國人民銀行（人民銀行）轄下的貿易金融區塊鏈平台，促進貿易融資數碼化；
- 研究央行數碼貨幣於跨境支付的應用；
- 探討「商業數據通」的技術可行性及研究新類型信貸評分模型，以助中小型企業（中小企）獲取融資；
- 公布旨在發展更具規模及更多元的合規科技生態圈的兩年計劃，進一步推動合規科技的應用；
- 加強培育人才；及
- 推進跨境金融科技合作。

金管局金融科技促進辦公室(FFO)與金管局各銀行部門聯手，在推動上述措施中發揮關鍵作用。

隨着主要金融市場指數開始加入內地在岸證券或增加其權重，流入人民幣資產的資金繼續加快步伐。香港得天獨厚，憑藉連繫內地資本市場的「滬港通」、「深港通」及「債券通」，在促進國際投資者增加人民幣資產配置方面發揮關鍵的作用。在2020年，「債券通」平均每日交易額增加82%，至約193億元人民幣。為完善「債券通」運作，金管局推出新措施，包括新設特別結算周期服務、延長交易時間及引入新安排，讓投資者在選擇銀行進行貨幣兌換與外幣對沖方面有較多彈性。繼「債券通」北向通取得成功，金管局又與人民銀行組成工作小組研究南向通的框架。

金管局亦繼續致力加強香港與粵港澳大灣區（大灣區）內地城市之間的金融配套措施。內地當局公布一系列政策措施，支持區內金融發展。於6月，人民銀行、金管局與澳門金融管理局（澳門金管局）聯合宣布決定實施跨境「理財通」。金管局一直與內地和本地當局以及業界緊密合作，制定有關實施細則。金管局亦就其他措施與內地當局保持聯繫，尋求為香港銀行擴大政策空間拓展更廣闊的跨境業務範疇。年內，香港繼續保持作為全球離岸人民幣業務樞紐的地位。香港的人民幣即時支付結算(RTGS)系統平均每日交易額創出1.2萬億元人民幣的新高。

金管局積極開拓新機遇，提升香港金融平台競爭力。為促進香港基金業務的發展，金管局與政府及業界緊密合作，為基金在本地落戶締造更有利的稅務及監管環境。金管局亦投入大量工作，繼續提升香港作為區內綠色及可持續金融樞紐的地位。與此同時，金管局加強市場推廣，向海外及內地持份者推廣香港的金融服務。

在中央銀行領域，金管局在多個區內及國際委員會擔當領導角色。例如，金管局為巴塞爾銀行監管委員會（巴塞爾委員會）轄下政策及標準小組，以及東亞及太平洋地區中央銀行會議(EMEAP)轄下金融市場工作小組主席。金管局亦擔任金融穩定理事會轄下非銀行監察專家小組及金融創新網絡聯席主席，並領導探討基準過渡相關監管事項的小組。

香港金融基建的安全及有效運作，為香港的國際金融中心地位奠定穩固基礎。處理銀行同業交易的4個RTGS系統、債務工具中央結算系統（CMU系統）及香港交易資料儲存庫（香港儲存庫）在2020年達到100%的系統可供使用率，高於99.95%的目標水平。透過於內地兩個中央證券託管機構的帳戶，CMU系統繼續協助結算「債券通」北向通交易，以及替相關CMU系統成員持有內地債務證券。

轉數快使用量在2020年繼續增長。截至2020年底合共錄得690萬個登記，全年交易量較2019年上升兩倍。政府接受以轉數快繳費及更多商戶採用，是轉數快在個人對個人支付穩步增長以外，交易額錄得顯著增長的主要原因。

為確保本地零售支付業的整體安全及效率，金管局根據《支付系統及儲值支付工具條例》（《支付條例》）指定及監察6個零售支付系統。金管局亦繼續監管18個儲值支付工具持牌人。

# 2020年回顧

# 香港的亞洲金融科技樞紐地位

# 轉數快

自2018年9月轉數快推出以來，已有35間銀行及12間儲值支付工具營運商加入，其中在2020年增加了5間銀行及1間儲值支付工具營運商。轉數快使用量亦穩步增長。截至12月31日，轉數快共錄得690萬個登記（圖1）。為方便市民收取由機構發出的款項，轉數快於12月6日起新增以香港身份證號碼作帳戶識別代號。引入這項功能後不足1個月已錄得超過110,000個登記。這項新功能並非用於個人對個人轉帳，只供已有收款人身份證號碼的機構發放款項（例如發放薪酬）之用。由於每名市民的身份證號碼都是獨一無二，市民利用香港身份證號碼作為帳戶識別代號，即使不提供銀行帳戶號碼都能夠確保準確收取款項。

圖 1 轉數快帳戶登記數目

新冠病毒疫情及保持社交距離措施為使用電子支付服務帶來新動力。年內轉數快交易量增長尤其迅速（圖2），於2020年12月的平均每日交易量達505,000宗即時交易（涉及52億港元及9,500萬元人民幣），相當於2019年12月168,000宗的3倍，更是2018年10月轉數快推出首月的10倍。轉數快使用量增加，亦受惠於應用範圍逐步擴大，由最初主要用作個人對個人支付，逐步擴展至繳付帳單（包括政府帳單）、零售及商業支付。

圖 2 港元即時支付平均每日交易數字

金管局與多個政府部門及銀行業一直合作，將轉數快的應用範圍由個人對個人支付，擴展至繳付帳單及其他商戶支付。政府於2019年11月起接受以轉數快繳付帳單，以推廣使用轉數快及便利市民。市民以支援轉數快的手機銀行或電子錢包掃描印於帳單上的二維碼，即可輕鬆繳付稅款、差餉及地租、水費及政府發出的一般繳費單。截至2020年12月經轉數快繳付政府帳單的交易達180萬宗，涉及22億港元。繼繳付政府帳單服務成功推出後，再有4個政府部門由2020年12月21日起接受在指定繳費櫃枱及自助服務機以轉數快二維碼繳費。政府亦正在探討於網上採用轉數快付款的安排。

另一正面的發展是越來越多大小商戶採用轉數快以加強業務營運。支付商戶的交易在2020年12月急增至平均每日100,000宗，較2019年12月增加38倍轉數快普遍用作繳付帳單、應用程式內直接扣帳，以及進行其他網上購物。電子錢包日益普及，亦帶動了以轉數快為帳戶增值的交易量顯著增長。2020年12月平均每日增值的交易量，是2019年12月的7倍。

為加強市民對轉數快的認識，金管局製作各類教育及宣傳資料，包括電視廣告及在社交媒體平台提供一系列精明使用錦囊。金管局亦舉辦中學生Whatsapp Stickers設計比賽，增加他們對電子支付的認識。此外，金管局向多個慈善團體及街市營運商推廣使用轉數快收付款項。多間參與轉數快的銀行及儲值支付工具營運商亦推出宣傳活動，包括提供優惠，吸引客戶登記及利用轉數快轉帳及支付帳單。在2020年的成果上，金管局在2021年初與銀行及儲值支付工具營運商合作，推廣透過轉數快以電子方式派利是。一方面金管局推出宣傳活動，另一方面銀行及儲值支付工具營運商則提供優惠，鼓勵客戶以電子方式派利是，既環保又有助抗疫。

# 開放應用程式介面

金管局繼續促進銀行業按照開放API框架研發及提供開放API。該框架分4個階段實施，銀行已推出第一及第二階段開放API，並以這些開放API與第三方服務提供者合作，開拓各項創新服務，提升客戶體驗。另一方面，金管局就實施第三及第四階段開放API進行調查研究，並於11月刊發小冊子，刊載調查結果。

# 貿易聯動

為使進出口商獲得更方便的貿易融資服務，金管局於年內展開概念驗證研究，探討連接「貿易聯動」與人民銀行轄下的貿易金融區塊鏈平台。該研究的首階段於年內第4季完成，並隨後開始試行。香港和內地銀行已用該連接成功完成多項跨境貿易融資交易。

# 跨境支付

央行數碼貨幣方面，金管局與泰國中央銀行繼續進行聯合研究，探討央行數碼貨幣於跨境支付的應用藉此促進香港與泰國兩地銀行之間港元和泰銖的外匯交易同步交收。雙方完成第一階段研究，並於1月發表聯合報告闡述主要研究結果；另亦開發以區塊鏈為基礎的跨境走廊網絡原型，致力提高跨境支付的效率及降低成本。項目第二階段已展開，旨在探討跨境貿易結算及資本市場交易的商業應用案例。其他央行亦對項目深感興趣。國際結算銀行、阿拉伯聯合酋長國中央銀行和人民銀行數字貨幣研究所於2021年初宣布參與項目。

# Hong Kong’s international financial centre status

Hong Kong continues to be an international financial centre with global competitiveness. During the year, the HKMA implemented various measures to promote the development and application of fintech in the banking and payment industries. During the year, the transaction volume of the Faster Payment System 'FPS' saw significant growth under the novel coronavirus pandemic.

Hong Kong is situated at a strategic position in the opening-up of the mainland's financial market and can fully seize the opportunities during the opening process. By leveraging world-class market infrastructure, including the "Shanghai-Hong Kong Connect," "Shenzhen-Hong Kong Connect," and "Bond Connect," Hong Kong serves as both a fundraising platform highly favored by mainland enterprises and a window for international investors to enter the rapidly growing mainland market. During the year, progress was made in promoting financial cooperation in the Guangdong-Hong Kong-Macau Greater Bay Area, particularly in facilitating Hong Kong residents' access to financial and banking services within the Greater Bay Area.

While HKMA actively opens up new opportunities, enhancing Hong Kong's financial platform, including asset and wealth management, corporate treasury centres, and competitiveness in the sustainable finance areas. HKMA also strengthens market promotion, promoting Hong Kong's financial services to overseas and Mainland stakeholders. On a global level, HKMA assumes leadership roles in multiple regional and international committees, fully highlighting Hong Kong's professional expertise and commitment in relevant international work.

# Overview

To consolidate Hong Kong's position as an Asia-Pacific fintech hub, the Hong Kong Monetary Authority continues to commit to implementing various measures to promote the development and application of technology in the banking and payment industries. Key progress this year includes:
- Promoting the wider adoption of the Faster Payment System (FPS);
- Promoting the implementation of open application programming interfaces (open APIs) in the banking sector;
- Connecting the Trade Finance Platform "TradeLink" with the Trade Finance Blockchain Platform under the People's Bank of China to promote the digitalization of trade finance;
- Researching the application of central bank digital currency in cross-border payments;
- Exploring the technical feasibility of "Commercial Data Connect" and researching new types of credit scoring models to help small and medium-sized enterprises (SMEs) obtain financing;
- Announcing a two-year plan aimed at developing a larger and more diverse compliance technology ecosystem, further promoting the application of compliance technology;
- Strengthening talent cultivation; and
- Advancing cross-border fintech cooperation.

The Fintech Promotion Office (FFO) of the Financial Services and Treasury Bureau collaborates with various banking departments to play a key role in promoting the aforementioned measures.

As major financial market indices begin to include mainland onshore securities or increase their weight, the funds flowing into RMB assets continue to accelerate. Hong Kong enjoys an unparalleled advantage, leveraging its links to the mainland capital markets through the "Shanghai-Hong Kong Connect," "Shenzhen-Hong Kong Connect," and "Bond Connect," playing a key role in promoting international investors to increase their RMB asset allocation. In 2020, the average daily transaction volume of "Bond Connect" increased by 82%, reaching approximately 19.3 billion RMB. To refine the operations of "Bond Connect," the HKMA introduced new measures, including new special settlement cycle services, extended trading hours, and introduced new arrangements, allowing investors more flexibility in choosing banks for currency exchange and foreign currency hedging. Following the success of the northbound component of "Bond Connect," the HKMA formed a working group with the People's Bank of China to study the framework for the southbound component.

The HKMA continues to strive to strengthen financial measures between Hong Kong and the Mainland cities within the Greater Bay Area (GBA). Authorities in the Mainland have publicly announced a series of policy measures to support financial development within the region. In June, the People's Bank of China, the HKMA, and the Macao Financial Authority (Macao MA) jointly announced the decision to implement the cross-border "Liquidity Channel." The HKMA has consistently worked closely with authorities in the Mainland and locally, as well as industry stakeholders, to formulate implementation details. The HKMA has also maintained communication with Mainland authorities on other measures, seeking to expand policy space for Hong Kong banks to broaden the scope of cross-border business. Throughout the year, Hong Kong has continued to maintain its position as a global offshore renminbi business hub. The average daily transaction amount of Hong Kong's renminbi real-time gross settlement (RTGS) system reached a new high of 1.2 trillion renminbi.

The HKMA actively explores new opportunities to enhance Hong Kong's financial platform competitiveness. To promote the development of Hong Kong's fund business, the HKMA collaborates closely with the government and industry stakeholders to create a more favorable tax and regulatory environment for funds to establish locally. The HKMA has also invested significant efforts to continue enhancing Hong Kong's status as a regional hub for green and sustainable finance. At the same time, the HKMA has strengthened market promotion, promoting Hong Kong's financial services to overseas and mainland stakeholders.

In the field of central banking, the HKMA holds leadership roles in multiple regional and international committees. For example, the HKMA serves as the Chair of the Policy and Standards Group under the Basel Committee on Banking Supervision (Basel Committee), as well as the Chair of the Financial Markets Working Group under the East Asia and Pacific Central Bankers' Meeting (EMEAP). The HKMA also serves as Co-Chair of the Non-Banking Oversight Expert Group under the Financial Stability Board and the Financial Innovation Network, and leads a group exploring regulatory matters related to benchmark transition.

The security and effective operation of Hong Kong's financial infrastructure lay a solid foundation for Hong Kong's status as an international financial centre. The four RTGS systems handling interbank transactions, the Central Securities Settlement System (CMU system), and the Hong Kong Trading Data Repository (Hong Kong Repository) achieved a 100% system availability rate in 2020, exceeding the target level of 99.95%. Through accounts at two central securities depositories in the Mainland, the CMU system continues to assist in settling 'Bond Connect' Northbound transactions and holds mainland debt securities for relevant CMU system members.

FPS usage continued to grow in 2020. As of the end of 2020, a total of 6.9 million registrations were recorded, with the annual transaction volume increasing by two times compared to 2019. The government's acceptance of FPS payments and the adoption by more merchants are the main reasons for the significant growth in transaction volume, apart from the steady growth in peer-to-peer payments.

To ensure the overall security and efficiency of the local retail payment industry, the Hong Kong Monetary Authority designates and oversees six retail payment systems under the Payment Systems and Stored Value Payment Tools Ordinance (the Payment Ordinance). The Hong Kong Monetary Authority also continues to regulate 18 licensed stored value payment tool providers.

# 2020 year review

# Hong Kong’s Status as Asia’s Fintech Hub

# FPS Faster

Since the launch of the Faster Payment System (FPS) in September 2018, 35 banks and 12 stored value payment tool operators have joined, with 5 banks and 1 stored value payment tool operator added in 2020. The usage of FPS has also steadily increased. As of December 31, the FPS has recorded 6.9 million registrations (Chart 1). To facilitate citizens receiving payments from institutions, FPS introduced the use of Hong Kong ID card numbers as account identification codes starting December 6. Within less than a month of introducing this feature, over 110,000 registrations were recorded. This new feature is not for person-to-person transfers but is only for institutions with recipient ID card numbers to disburse payments (e.g., issuing salaries). Since each citizen's ID number is unique, citizens can ensure accurate receipt of payments by using their Hong Kong ID card numbers as account identification codes, even without providing bank account numbers.

Chart 1: Faster Payment System Account Registered Number

The novel coronavirus pandemic and social distancing measures provided new momentum for the use of electronic payment services. Transaction volume growth of the Faster Payment System was particularly rapid during the year, with the average daily transaction volume in December 2020 reaching 505,000 instant transactions (involving HKD 52 billion and CNY 950 million), equivalent to three times the 168,000 transactions in December 2019, and ten times the volume in the first month after FPS was launched in October 2018. The increased usage of FPS also benefited from the gradual expansion of its application scope, which initially mainly served person-to-person payments and has since expanded to paying bills (including government bills), retail, and commercial payments.

Chart 2: Average daily transaction figures for immediate HK$ payments

The Hong Kong Monetary Authority has been collaborating with multiple government departments and the banking industry to expand the application scope of the Faster Payment System (FPS) from person-to-person payments to bill payments and other merchant transactions. The government started accepting FPS for bill payments in November 2019 to promote FPS usage and convenience for citizens. Citizens can easily pay taxes, ratings, rent, water bills, and general payment slips issued by the government by scanning QR codes printed on bills using mobile banks or e-wallets that support FPS. By December 2020, FPS transactions for government bills reached 1.8 million, involving HKD 2.2 billion. Following the successful launch of the government bill payment service, four more government departments started accepting FPS QR codes at designated payment counters and self-service machines from December 21, 2020. The government is also exploring arrangements to adopt FPS for online payments.

Another positive development is the increasing adoption of FPS by businesses of all sizes to strengthen business operations. Transactions by payment merchants surged to an average of 100,000 daily in December 2020, a 38-fold increase compared to December 2019. FPS is widely used for paying bills, direct deductions within applications, and other online shopping activities. The increasing popularity of electronic wallets has also driven significant growth in transaction volume using FPS as a means of account value enhancement. The average daily transaction volume for value-added services in December 2020 was seven times that of December 2019.

To strengthen the public's understanding of FPS, the HKMA produced various educational and promotional materials, including TV advertisements and a series of smart usage tips provided on social media platforms. The HKMA also held a secondary school students' WhatsApp Stickers design competition to increase their understanding of electronic payments. Additionally, the HKMA promoted the use of FPS for payments among multiple charitable organizations and market operators. Multiple banks and stored value payment tool operators participating in FPS also launched promotional activities, including offering Best Lending Rates to attract customers to register and use FPS for transfers and bill payments. Building on the achievements of 2020, the HKMA collaborated with banks and stored value payment tool operators in early 2021 to promote the distribution of e-laisee via FPS electronically. On one hand, the HKMA launched promotional activities; on the other hand, banks and stored value payment tool operators offered discounts to encourage customers to distribute e-laisee electronically, which is both environmentally friendly and helpful in combating the pandemic.

# Open Application Programming Interface

The HKMA continues to promote the banking industry to develop and provide open APIs in accordance with the open API framework. The framework is implemented in four phases. Banks have launched the first and second phases of open APIs and have collaborated with third-party service providers using these open APIs to explore various innovative services and enhance customer experience. On the other hand, the HKMA is conducting research and investigation on the implementation of the third and fourth phases of open APIs and published a booklet in November containing the survey results.

# Trade Linked Exchange Rate System

To enable importers and exporters to obtain more convenient trade financing services, the Hong Kong Monetary Authority launched a concept validation study within the year, exploring the connection between "Trade Linkage" and the trade finance blockchain platform under the People's Bank of China. The first phase of the study was completed in the fourth quarter of the year and subsequently began trials. Hong Kong and Mainland banks have successfully completed multiple cross-border trade financing transactions using the connection.

# cross-border payment

In the area of central bank digital currency (CBDC), the Hong Kong Monetary Authority and the Thai central bank continue joint research to explore the application of CBDC in cross-border payments, thereby promoting synchronous settlement of Hong Kong dollar and Thai baht foreign exchange transactions between banks in Hong Kong and Thailand. Both parties have completed the first phase of research and published a joint report outlining the main research findings in January. They have also developed a blockchain-based cross-border corridor network prototype, striving to enhance the efficiency of cross-border payments and reduce costs. Phase II of the project has been initiated, aiming to explore commercial application cases for cross-border trade settlement and capital market transactions. Other central banks have also shown strong interest in the project. The International Settlement Bank, the Central Bank of the United Arab Emirates, and the Digital Currency Research Institute of the People's Bank of China announced their participation in the project in early 2021.

# 儲備管理

2020年是峰迴路轉的一年，新冠病毒疫情為全球經濟帶來前所未有的挑戰。資產市場於第1 季經歷了大幅調整和震盪後，在主要央行推出超寬鬆的貨幣政策及各地政府實施大規模的財政紓困措施帶動下，得以迅速反彈。由於主要央行大幅下調基準利率並重啟量化寬鬆措施，令國債收益率顯著下跌、債券價格上升。在此投資環境下，外匯基金在2020 年錄得2,358 億港元的投資收入，回報率為5.3%。

# 外匯基金

根據《外匯基金條例》，外匯基金的首要目的是直接或間接影響港元匯價，亦可運用於保持香港貨幣及金融體系穩定健全，藉此保持香港作為國際金融中心的地位。金管局根據財政司司長轉授的權力及轉授權力的條款，就外匯基金的運用及投資管理向財政司司長負責。

# 外匯基金的管理

# 投資目標及組合架構

外匯基金諮詢委員會為外匯基金制定下列投資目標：
(a) 保障資本；
(b) 確保整體貨幣基礎在任何時候都由流通性極高的美元資產提供十足支持；
(c) 確保流動資金足以維持貨幣及金融穩定；以及
(d) 在符合上述(a)至(c)項的前提下盡量爭取投資回報，以保障基金的長期購買力。

以上目標全面顧及外匯基金的法定目的，並已於外匯基金的組合結構及目標資產配置中反映。

外匯基金大致上分成兩個主要組合：支持組合及投資組合。支持組合持有流通性極高的美元資產，按照貨幣發行局制度的規定為貨幣基礎提供十足支持。投資組合主要投資於經濟合作與發展組織成員國的債市及股市，以保障資產的價值及長期購買力。

為能更妥善管理風險及提高中長期回報，金管局以審慎及循序漸進方式將外匯基金的部分資產配置於較多元化的資產類別，包括新興巿場及內地債券與股票、私募股權（包括基建）及房地產。新興巿場及內地債券與股票由投資組合持有，私募股權及房地產投資則由長期增長組合持有。長期增長組合的市值上限為外匯基金累計盈餘的三分之一，以及未來基金存款與外匯基金附屬公司存款中與長期增長組合掛鈎部分的總和。

策略性資產組合於2007年設立，一直持有政府基於策略性目的而為外匯基金帳目購入的香港交易及結算所有限公司股份。由於這個組合性質獨特，因此外匯基金的投資表現評估並無將其包括在內。

# 於外匯基金的存款

外匯基金不時接受財政儲備、政府基金及法定組織的存款，利率一般與投資組合的表現掛鈎，但未來基金屬主要個別例子。未來基金存款的利率與投資組合及長期增長組合的表現掛鈎，實際利率視乎組合比重而定。未來基金在投資組合與長期增長組合的比重約為40：60。

# 投資程序

外匯基金的投資程序分別以策略性資產配置及戰略性資產配置作基礎。策略性資產配置，會以投資基準方式反映，亦即外匯基金為達到投資目標而可作出的長線資產配置。外匯基金以策略性配置作為指引，透過戰略性的資產配置，以爭取超越基準的回報。因此，實際配置往往會與基準配置（亦即策略性配置）有所偏離，而實際與基準配置之間的差距稱為「戰略性偏離」。財政司司長經諮詢外匯基金諮詢委員會後制定投資基準及循跡誤差限額，金管局獲授權決定戰略性資產配置及定出戰略性偏離的容許範圍。投資組合經理可在戰略性偏離的容許範圍內管理倉盤，從短期市場變化中獲利。

# 投資管理

# 直接投資

金管局的外匯基金投資辦公室專責投資及相關風險管理職能。該辦公室職員負責直接管理外匯基金約72%的投資，包括整個支持組合及部分投資組合。該部分投資組合包括不同的環球定息市場投資，並透過衍生工具執行外匯基金的宏觀風險管理策略。

# 外聘投資經理

除透過內部職員管理資產外，金管局亦僱用外聘投資經理負責管理外匯基金約28%的資產，包括所有上市股票組合及其他特別資產。僱用外聘投資經理的目的是要運用市場上最佳的專業投資專才為外匯基金投資，獲取可持續回報，並讓外匯基金受惠於多元化及互補的投資方式，以及汲取市場心得與專門的投資知識。

僱用外聘投資經理的相關支出包括基金管理與託管費、交易費、預扣稅及其他稅項。這些支出主要受市場因素影響而每年不同。

# 風險管理及監察

投資環境越趨複雜，風險管理的重要性不言而喻。金管局為內部及外聘投資經理所管理的投資組合均訂下嚴格管控措施及投資指引，並設立嚴謹的風險監察及合規制度。金管局為投資相關活動設有三重防線以確保有效的風險管理及監察。金管局亦定期監察主要投資風險類別（包括信用、市場、流動性及業務操作風險），並已加強風險管理程序以配合外匯基金的多元化投資。

# 負責任投資

金管局支持負責任投資，將環境、社會及管治(ESG)因素併入外匯基金的公開市場及私募市場的投資管理過程。

金管局訂有一套原則，以評估外匯基金投資項目的ESG風險與機會。就外聘投資經理所管理的資產組合而言，金管局透過獲委任的投資經理執行負責任投資。在甄選、委任及監察外聘投資經理的過程中，金管局會評估其落實ESG的不同範疇，包括ESG管治方面的組織架構、ESG標準及政策、將ESG因素併入投資程序中的情況，以及管理督導的業務活動，即代理投票和與投資組合公司的溝通（例如與投資組合公司管理層商討ESG的事宜）。為彰顯對負責任投資的重視，金管局透過外聘投資經理在管理督導方面扮演的角色，推動更完善的ESG做法。負責管理金管局的香港股票組合及中國內地股票主動投資管理組合的外聘投資經理，須承諾遵守證券及期貨事務監察委員會頒布的《負責任的擁有權原則》，若未能遵守則須作出解釋。至於負責管理已發展市場股票組合的外聘投資經理則需恪守國際公認的ESG標準。此外，金管局又展開聘任後監察計劃，以審視外聘投資經理的代理投票及與投資組合公司溝通的落實概況。

由金管局內部人員負責管理的定息投資組合，亦將ESG因素融入債券投資的信用風險分析中。藉著擴大ESG數據來源以及在量化評估中提高ESG因素的權重，加強相關的分析。

至於在公開市場的ESG投資，金管局自2015年起投資於綠色、社會責任及可持續債券（ESG債券），是這個市場的早期投資者之一。此外，金管局亦參與國際金融公司的「聯合貸款組合管理計劃」，而其投資對象聚焦於新興市場的可持續發展項目。在2020年，適逢市場供應增加，金管局增加ESG債券的投資。展望未來，金管局將繼續透過直接投資或持有ESG債券基金等方式，壯大其ESG債券組合。此外，金管局將透過採納ESG股票指數作為被動投資組合的投資基準，推動外聘投資經理建立以ESG為主題的股票投資方針。金管局在未來幾年將會繼續留意以ESG為主題的投資機會，例如主動式的ESG投資組合及低碳為題的投資工具。

私募市場投資方面，金管局在盡職審查過程中檢視專責合夥人的ESG政策及具體措施。金管局的長期增長組合積極投資於具備可持續特點的項目，包括可再生能源基建，而在房地產投資組合亦有吸納具有綠色及可持續特點的倉庫及其他建築物。金管局將在未來繼續物色具備可持續特點的項目，並在房地產投資方面將綠色認證列入為重要考慮因素。金管局與專責合夥人舉行年度ESG工作坊，就良好的ESG作業手法交流意見及經驗。在11月舉行的ESG工作坊上，一眾專責合夥人就新冠病毒疫情對其投資組合公司及ESG投資發展所造成的影響交換意見。為提高私募市場投資的ESG透明度，金管局已要求專責合夥人提供有關其投資項目的ESG資訊，例如氣候變化風險等，以便監察。

金管局往後仍會密切觀察ESG標準的發展，評估如何將有關標準進一步融入投資程序，當中包括與理念相近的投資者及國際組織互動合作。金管局作為聯合國支持的《負責任投資原則》的簽署人之一，肩負作為全球倡導者的責任，日後將會參與制定ESG最佳作業手法，並推動其他投資者採納負責任的投資方法。金管局亦是非牟利機構 FCLTGlobal 的成員，該機構旨在透過舉辦工作坊及研究，鼓勵以長遠目標為本的業務及投資決策。金管局亦有參與「氣候相關財務資訊披露工作小組」，並為「央行與監管機構綠色金融網絡」的成員。此外，金管局籌辦講座及積極參與投資業界舉辦的活動，分享及推廣有關ESG投資的理念。

有關金管局的負責任投資政策架構，詳見「機構社會責任」一章。

# Reserves Management

2020 was a year of twists and turns, with the pandemic bringing unprecedented challenges to the global economy. After experiencing sharp adjustments and volatility in the first quarter, asset markets rebounded quickly under the support of extremely accommodative monetary policies introduced by major central banks and large-scale fiscal stimulus measures implemented by governments around the world. Due to major central banks' significant cuts in benchmark interest rates and the resumption of quantitative easing measures, sovereign bond yields declined notably while bond prices rose. In this investment environment, the Exchange Fund recorded HK$235.8 billion in investment income, with a return rate of 5.3%.

# Foreign Exchange Fund

Under the Exchange Fund Ordinance, the primary objective of the Exchange Fund is to directly or indirectly influence the exchange rate of the Hong Kong dollar, and it may also be used to maintain the stability and soundness of Hong Kong's monetary and financial system, thereby maintaining Hong Kong's position as an international financial centre. The Monetary Authority is responsible to the Financial Secretary for the management and investment of the Exchange Fund, based on the delegated authority and the terms of delegated powers conferred by the Financial Secretary.

# Management of the Exchange Fund

# Investment Objectives and Portfolio Structure

The Exchange Fund Advisory Committee formulates the following investment objectives for the Exchange Fund:
(a) Safeguard capital;
(b) Ensure that the monetary base is at all times fully supported by US dollar assets with high liquidity;
(c) Ensure that liquidity is sufficient to maintain monetary and financial stability; and
(d) Strive to achieve investment returns, subject to the above (a) to (c), in order to safeguard the long-term purchasing power of the fund.

The above objectives comprehensively take into account the statutory purposes of the Exchange Fund and have been reflected in the portfolio structure and target asset allocation of the Exchange Fund.

The Exchange Fund is broadly divided into two major portfolios: the Support Portfolio and the Investment Portfolio. The Support Portfolio holds US dollar assets with high liquidity, providing full support to the monetary base in accordance with the Currency Board System's regulations. The Investment Portfolio primarily invests in bond and stock markets of OECD member countries to safeguard the value of assets and long-term purchasing power.

To more effectively manage risks and enhance long-term returns, the Hong Kong Monetary Authority (HKMA) has allocated part of the Exchange Fund's assets in a prudent and phased manner to more diversified asset categories, including emerging markets and mainland China bonds and stocks, private equity (PE), including infrastructure, and real estate. Emerging markets and mainland China bonds and stocks are held by investment portfolios, while private equity and real estate investments are held by the long-term growth portfolio. The market value cap of the long-term growth portfolio is set at one-third of the Exchange Fund's accumulated surplus, as well as the total sum of deposits linked to the long-term growth portfolio in future fund deposits and Exchange Fund subsidiary company deposits.

Strategic asset portfolio was established in 2007 and has always held shares of Hong Kong Exchanges and Clearing Limited purchased by the government for strategic purposes under the Exchange Fund accounts. Due to the unique nature of this portfolio, the Exchange Fund's investment performance assessment did not include it.

# Deposits in the Exchange Fund

The Exchange Fund occasionally accepts deposits from financial reserves, government funds, and statutory bodies, with interest rates generally linked to the performance of the investment portfolio. However, the Future Fund is a major individual example. The interest rate on Future Fund deposits is linked to the performance of the investment portfolio and the long-term growth portfolio, with the actual interest rate depending on the portfolio weightings. The proportion of the Future Fund in the investment portfolio and the long-term growth portfolio is approximately 40:60.

# Investment Process

The investment procedures of the Exchange Fund are based on strategic asset allocation and tactical asset allocation. Strategic asset allocation is reflected through the investment benchmark, i.e., the long-term asset allocation that the Exchange Fund can make to achieve its investment objectives. The Exchange Fund uses strategic allocation as a guideline, through tactical asset allocation, to seek returns exceeding the benchmark. Therefore, actual allocation often deviates from the benchmark allocation (i.e., strategic allocation), and the gap between actual and benchmark allocation is called "strategic deviation." The Financial Secretary (FS), after consulting the Exchange Fund Advisory Committee, sets the investment benchmark and the tracking error limit. The Hong Kong Monetary Authority is authorized to determine the strategic asset allocation and set the allowable range for strategic deviation. Portfolio managers can manage the portfolio within the allowable range of strategic deviation to gain from short-term market changes.

# Investment Management

# Direct Investment

The Exchange Fund Investment Office of the Hong Kong Monetary Authority is dedicated to investment and related risk management functions. The office's staff members are responsible for directly managing approximately 72% of the Exchange Fund's investments, including the entire support portfolio and some investment portfolios. These investment portfolios include various global fixed-rate market investments and execute the Exchange Fund's macro risk management strategy through derivatives.

# External Investment Manager

In addition to managing assets through internal staff, the Hong Kong Monetary Authority also hires external investment managers to be responsible for managing approximately 28% of the Exchange Fund's assets, including all listed stock portfolios and other special assets. The purpose of hiring external investment managers is to utilize the best professional investment talents available in the market to invest in the Exchange Fund, achieve sustainable returns, and allow the Exchange Fund to benefit from diversified and complementary investment methods, as well as draw on market insights and specialized investment knowledge.

Expenses related to hiring an external investment manager include fund management and custody fees, transaction fees, withholding taxes, and other taxes. These expenses are mainly affected by market factors and vary each year.

# Risk Management and Oversight

As the investment environment becomes increasingly complex, the importance of risk management is self-evident. The HKMA has established strict control measures and investment guidelines for investment portfolios managed by both internal and external investment managers, and has set up a rigorous risk oversight and compliance system. The HKMA has implemented a three-line defense system for investment-related activities to ensure effective risk management and oversight. The HKMA also regularly monitors major investment risk categories, including credit risk, market risk, liquidity risk, and operational risk, and has strengthened risk management procedures to align with the Exchange Fund's diversified investment strategy.

# Responsible Investment

Hong Kong Monetary Authority supports Responsible Investment, incorporating environment, society, and governance (ESG) factors into the investment management process of the Exchange Fund's public and private markets.

The HKMA has established a set of principles to assess ESG risks and opportunities associated with the Exchange Fund's investment projects. Regarding external investment managers, the HKMA executes responsible investment through appointed investment managers. In the process of selecting, appointing, and supervising external investment managers, the HKMA evaluates their implementation of ESG across various areas, including the organizational structure for ESG governance, ESG standards and policies, the integration of ESG factors into investment procedures, and the business activities related to management oversight, such as proxy voting and communication with portfolio companies (e.g., discussing ESG matters with the management of portfolio companies). To emphasize the importance of responsible investment, the HKMA promotes more refined ESG practices by leveraging the role of external investment managers in management oversight. External investment managers responsible for managing the HKMA's Hong Kong equities portfolio and the active investment management portfolio of Chinese mainland equities must commit to complying with the "Principles of Responsible Ownership" issued by the Securities and Futures Affairs Supervision Committee, and must provide explanations if they fail to comply. For external investment managers responsible for managing portfolios of equities in developed markets, they are required to adhere to internationally recognized ESG standards. In addition, the HKMA has initiated a post-employment monitoring program to review the implementation status of proxy voting and communication with portfolio companies by external investment managers.

The fixed-rate investment portfolio managed by internal personnel of the Hong Kong Monetary Authority also incorporates ESG factors into the credit risk analysis of bond investments. By expanding the sources of ESG data and increasing the weight of ESG factors in quantitative assessments, the related analysis is strengthened.

Regarding ESG investments in the public market, the HKMA has invested in green, social responsibility, and sustainable bonds (ESG bonds) since 2015, becoming one of the early investors in this market. In addition, the HKMA also participates in the International Finance Corporation's "Joint Loan Portfolio Management Program," with its investment focus on sustainable development projects in emerging markets. In 2020, coinciding with increased market supply, the HKMA increased its investment in ESG bonds. Looking ahead, the HKMA will continue to expand its ESG bond portfolio through direct investment or holding ESG bond funds, among other ways. Furthermore, the HKMA will adopt ESG equity indices as the benchmark for passive investment portfolios, promoting external investment managers to establish investment mandates themed on ESG. In the coming years, the HKMA will continue to closely monitor investment opportunities themed on ESG, such as active ESG investment portfolios and low-carbon themed investment tools.

In the private equity market investment area, the HKMA reviews the ESG policies and specific measures of specialized partners during the due diligence process. The HKMA's long-term growth portfolio actively invests in projects with sustainable characteristics, including renewable energy infrastructure, and also incorporates warehouses and other buildings with green and sustainable characteristics into its real estate investment portfolio. The HKMA will continue to identify projects with sustainable characteristics in the future and will include green certification as an important consideration factor in real estate investments. The HKMA holds annual ESG workshops with specialized partners to exchange opinions and experiences on good ESG operational practices. During the ESG workshop held in November, a group of specialized partners exchanged opinions on the impact of the novel coronavirus pandemic on their portfolio companies and ESG investment development. To enhance the transparency of ESG in private equity market investments, the HKMA has requested specialized partners to provide ESG information related to their investment projects, such as climate change risks, for monitoring.

The HKMA will continue to closely monitor the development of ESG standards, evaluate how to further incorporate the relevant standards into the investment process, including engaging in collaboration with investors and international organizations that share similar principles. As one of the signatories of the United Nations-supported Principles for Responsible Investment, the HKMA shoulders the responsibility of being a global advocate and will participate in developing best practices for ESG, and promote other investors to adopt responsible investment approaches. The HKMA is also a member of the non-profit organization FCLTGlobal, which aims to encourage business and investment decisions based on long-term goals through workshops and research. The HKMA also participates in the "Task Force on Climate-related Financial Disclosures" and is a member of the "Network for Green Finance of Central Banks and Supervisors." In addition, the HKMA organizes talks and actively participates in activities organized by the investment industry, sharing and promoting the concept of ESG investing.

Regarding the responsible investment policy framework of the Hong Kong Monetary Authority, see Chapter "Institutional Social Responsibility".

# Performance of the Foreign Exchange Fund

# 2020 year's financial market

In response to the significant challenges brought by the novel coronavirus pandemic to the global economy, global financial markets reached a high level by the end of the year under the support of loose monetary and fiscal policies. Global stock markets quickly rebounded after experiencing significant adjustments and volatility in the first quarter, with major markets recording double-digit growth. The US S&P 500 Index rose 16%, making it the best-performing of the seven major industrial countries' stock indices in 2020.

In the bond market, bond yields of major developed countries continued to face pressure after a significant drop in the first quarter. The yield on 10-year US Treasury bonds fell by about 100 basis points from 1.9% at the start of the year to 0.9% by the end of the year. Due to a sharp rise in major bond prices, the market recorded substantial valuation gains in 2020.

In the currency market, the downward trend in US interest rates led to the narrowing of interest rate gaps, causing the US dollar to weaken against major currencies. The situation became more pronounced in the second half of 2020, with the euro and renminbi appreciating against the US dollar by approximately 9.0% and 6.5% respectively.

# Performance of the Foreign Exchange Fund

The Exchange Fund recorded HK$235.8 billion in investment income in 2020, including bond investment gains of HK$92.7 billion, Hong Kong stock investment gains of HK$4 billion, other stock investment gains of HK$69.9 billion, a HK$9.6 billion upward adjustment in foreign exchange valuation of non-HKD assets, and investment gains from other investments held by the Exchange Fund's investment holding subsidiaries of HK$59.6 billion. # 機構職能

金管局透過傳統及社交媒體、網站、資訊中心及其他渠道與社會及市場保持有效溝通，增進公眾對金管局政策及運作的了解。對內方面，金管局亦致力加強機構管治，包括支持員工提升專業能力、嚴格控制財政、加強資訊科技保安，以及鼓勵創新文化，以應對推行新項目及日益繁重的工作所帶來的挑戰。

# 與公眾保持聯繫

# 傳媒關係與社交媒體

金管局與傳媒保持緊密聯繫，以提高金管局的透明度，並增進公眾對其政策及運作的了解。金管局在2020年共舉辦93次實體及線上活動，包括8次新聞發布會、5次即場訪問及80次其他公開活動，又安排了14次媒體訪談，並發布552份雙語新聞稿，每日亦處理大量傳媒查詢。

為增進社會對金管局主要職能的認識，金管局為本地和海外媒體以及言論具影響力的人士舉辦傳媒簡報會及工作坊，涵蓋聯繫匯率制度、金融科技、綠色金融及宏觀審慎監管措施等主題。

金管局總裁余偉文先生在「香港金融科技周2020」主持線上專題討論。

金管局副總裁阮國恒先生（中）主持傳媒簡報會，介紹金管局制定的促進合規科技應用兩年計劃。

金管局金融科技總監周文正先生（左）接受彭博訪問。

金管局透過社交媒體增進各界對其工作的了解，以及加強與公眾溝通，目前共營運5個社交媒體專頁，包括 Facebook、Instagram、LinkedIn、Twitter及YouTube。截至2020年12月底，逾66,500名用戶關注金管局的社交媒體專頁。針對新冠病毒疫情，金管局善用社交媒體繼續與公眾聯繫，以及有效澄清與金融及銀行體系穩定相關的不實謠言。

# 公眾查詢

公眾查詢服務是增進市民對金管局主要職能及運作認識的有效渠道，在2020年共處理9,514宗查詢，其中約一半涉及銀行業政策及規例、銀行消費者事宜、紙幣與硬幣、金融基建及債券市場發展，特別是硬幣收集計劃、銀行產品及服務、銀行業相關指引及通告、零售債券發行計劃，以及貨幣與經濟數據。

# 刊物

除金管局《年報》外，年內金管局出版兩期《貨幣與金融穩定情況半年度報告》及4期《季報》，並定期更新《金融數據月報》資料，提供有關香港貨幣、銀行業及經濟事務的最新及專題資料與分析。此外，金管局共發表18篇《匯思》文章，介紹金管局的重要措施及政策，並討論公眾關注的事項。

# 金管局網站

金管局的官方網站(www.hkma.gov.hk)提供4萬多頁英文及繁簡字體中文版資料，方便公眾查閱金管局的最新資訊。網站亦載有根據《銀行業條例》第20條備存的「認可機構及本地代表辦事處紀錄冊」及「認可機構證券業務員工紀錄冊」，以及根據《支付系統及儲值支付工具條例》備存的「儲值支付工具持牌人紀錄冊」。

金管局自2018年起透過開放應用程式介面（開放API），分階段發放在其網站所載的金融數據及重要資訊。截至2020年底，金管局如期在網站推出合共144組開放API。

金管局積極支持開放API的發展及應用。

# 金管局資訊中心

金管局資訊中心設於國際金融中心2期55樓，向公眾介紹金管局工作及提高公眾對貨幣與銀行業事宜的了解。資訊中心分為展覽館及圖書館兩部分。展覽館以互動方式介紹金管局的工作，以及香港貨幣與銀行業的發展；另備資料與展品，供研究香港貨幣、銀行業與金融事務。毗鄰展覽館的圖書館收藏超過26,000本書籍、期刊及其他刊物，以供研究香港貨幣、銀行業、金融和中央銀行事務等課題。圖書館亦備存《銀行業條例》第20條規定的「認可機構及本地代表辦事處紀錄冊」及「認可機構證券業務員工紀錄冊」。

金管局資訊中心憑藉其精心設計及獨樹一格的氛圍，從全球各地千多名參賽者中脫穎而出，成為「2020年MUSE DESIGN AWARDS」室內設計組別白金獎的得獎者之一。

資訊中心善用在2020年因應新冠病毒疫情暫停開放的時機，優化了「政策」展區的設施。該展區闡述金管局的工作，並介紹相關的金融概念。有關優化措施是因應訪客意見而作出，使互動設施更易使用、更富趣味及更耐用，令參觀過程更有樂趣。

資訊中心「政策」展區的互動設施完成優化工程。

資訊中心的展覽館部分介紹金管局的工作及香港貨幣與銀行業的發展。

為確保公眾人士不論種族都能平等地享用資訊中心的設施，中心制定程序，為有需要的訪客及致電中心熱線查詢的人士提供傳譯服務。

資訊中心的開放及服務時間因疫情持續而受到影響。為保障公眾安全及維持高水平的衛生環境，年內資訊中心實施特別開放安排及防疫措施，並加強清潔及消毒，設施及展品更定期以長效殺菌塗層消毒。

# 公眾及消費者教育

為與社區保持聯繫及增進市民對金管局工作的認識，金管局在2020年舉辦了一場網上公眾教育講座，吸引1,600多名來自61間中學的師生參加。講座內容涵蓋金管局工作簡介、聯繫匯率制度、香港鈔票、保障個人數碼鎖匙及存款保障計劃。教育講座自1998年推出以來，首次以網上形式舉行，至今已有超過61,000名師生參與。

超過1,600名來自61間中學的師生參加金管局網上公眾教育講座。

金管局教育公眾做個精明及負責任的金融服務消費者，並就此與公眾保持聯繫。相關教育工作的其中一個重點繼續是「保護個人數碼鎖匙」，年內金管局製作了一系列短片，呼籲市民不論何時何地都要妥善保管財務帳戶及個人資料。鑑於新冠病毒疫情下網上騙案有所增加，金管局提醒市民在網上購物或使用個人認證資料時要提高警覺，慎防詐騙圈套。

為提高年青人加入金管局工作的興趣，金管局於2020年推出公眾教育網劇《STEPS》，並在社交媒體發布一系列相關貼文，介紹金管局在貨幣、聯繫匯率制度、金融科技、普及金融、銀行監管與國際合作等範疇的工作。

公眾教育網劇《STEPS》以輕鬆的手法，透過一個新入職年青人的成長故事，介紹金管局的主要職能。

金管局在數碼平台及戶外媒體廣泛宣傳保護個人數碼鎖匙的訊息。

金管局又透過多個社區參與活動與不同持份者合作，而其中一項是網上親子理財教育活動 《小小理財師》，透過動畫影片、線上遊戲、自製玩具、可下載工作紙及填色比賽，教導幼稚園及初小學生金錢和理財的基本概念，以及有關銀行及支付服務的基本知識。

以Dollar豬和金氏一家為主角的動畫影片，就五個主題發放訊息。

示範以環保物料自製玩具。

其他有關年青人教育的工作包括網上理財問答比賽及為中學生及老師而設的網上教育講座、與一個專業團體攜手製作以小學生及家長為對象的漫畫書，以及為大專學生舉辦網上講座。

金管局支持投資者及理財教育委員會提升香港市民的金融理財知識及能力，並會研究與持份者進一步合作，提高社區參與的成效。

# 金管局員工

金管局是政府架構的一部分，但按非公務員條款聘請員工，吸引具適當經驗及專門知識的人才。金管局聘用、培訓及維持一支專業優秀的工作團隊，以履行政策目標及靈活應對工作要求的轉變。

金管局在2020年的人手編制為1,005人。年內，金管局致力透過靈活調配現有資源、提升效率及精簡工作程序，以配合新項目的需要及日益繁重的工作。金管局在2021年的人手編制將維持1,005人，並會重新調配現有資源，應付下述新開展及有所擴展的工作：

# 銀行及金融體系穩定
- 支援「理財通」的政策發展工作，以及其他粵港澳大灣區（大灣區）與私人財富管理措施，以及持續監管「理財通」業務
- 處理《保險業條例》及新的場外衍生工具制度下的發牌工作，以及有關虛擬銀行的操守監管工作
- 實施有關氣候風險的新監管規定，以及加強對銀行的審慎監管

# 儲備管理
- 加強投資、風險管理及其他必要支援，以配合外匯基金持續擴展及多元化的投資工作

# 香港的國際金融中心地位
- 為加強參與金融穩定理事會及其他國際工作小組提供支援
- 管理新近建議的附帶權益稅務寬減制度，以及核實可合資格獲稅務寬減的基金

表1按部門列出金管局的職位編制及實際職員人數。

表 1 2021年1月1日金管局職位編制及實際職員人數

# 薪酬福利政策及薪酬檢討機制

財政司司長透過外匯基金諮詢委員會聽取其轄下管治委員會的意見，並參考市場薪酬水平及做法，決定金管局員工的薪酬及服務條件。薪酬組合包括現金薪酬及公積金，另設一些基本福利。現金薪酬包括每月固定薪酬（即基本薪酬）及根據員工工作表現每年一次過發放的浮動薪酬。

財政司司長每年檢討金管局員工薪酬時，會透過外匯基金諮詢委員會聽取其轄下管治委員會的建議，並考慮管治委員會對金管局過去一年的表現評估、獨立人力資源顧問公司進行的金融業薪酬調查結果，以及其他相關因素。個別工作表現優秀的員工的薪酬亦可能獲得特別調整，以作獎勵及保持其薪酬競爭力。

金管局按個別員工的工作表現，分配獲批准用作調整年度固定薪酬及浮動薪酬的款項；而適用於負責投資的員工的浮動薪酬制度，則旨在加強其投資表現與薪酬的連繫。助理總裁及以上職級員工的固定薪酬調整及浮動薪酬的發放，是由財政司司長經參考管治委員會的意見後批准，有關員工在會議討論到其薪酬的議案時會避席。主管及以下職級員工的固定薪酬調整及浮動薪酬的發放，則由金管局總裁根據財政司司長授權，按照獲批准用作支付薪酬的整筆款項來決定。

# Functions of Institutions

The HKMA maintains effective communication with the public and markets through traditional and social media, websites, information centers, and other channels, enhancing the public's understanding of the HKMA's policies and operations. Internally, the HKMA is committed to strengthening institutional governance, including supporting employees in enhancing their professional capabilities, strictly controlling finances, strengthening information technology security, and encouraging an innovative culture, to address the challenges brought about by implementing new projects and the increasingly complex workload.

# Maintain a link with the public

# Media Relations and Social Media

The HKMA maintains close contact with the media to enhance its transparency and to enhance the public's understanding of its policies and operations. The HKMA held a total of 93 physical and online events in 2020, including 8 press conferences, 5 on-site interviews, and 80 other public events, and arranged 14 media interviews, and released 552 bilingual press releases, and also handled a large number of media inquiries daily.

To enhance society's understanding of the HKMA's main functions, the HKMA organized media briefings and workshops for local and overseas media and influential opinion leaders, covering topics such as the Linked Exchange Rate System, fintech, green finance, and macroprudential regulatory measures.

Mr. Yu Wai-man, Governor of the Hong Kong Monetary Authority, chaired an online special discussion at the "Hong Kong Fintech Week 2020".

Mr. Man Kuet Hang, Deputy Governor of the HKMA (middle), chaired the media briefings, introducing the two-year plan formulated by the HKMA to promote the application of compliance technology.

Mr. Zhou Wenzheng, Director of Fintech at the Financial Authority (left), was interviewed by Bloomberg.

The Hong Kong Monetary Authority enhances understanding of its work among various sectors and strengthens communication with the public through social media. It currently operates five social media pages, including Facebook, Instagram, LinkedIn, Twitter, and YouTube. As of the end of December 2020, over 66,500 users followed the Hong Kong Monetary Authority's social media pages. In view of the novel coronavirus pandemic, the Hong Kong Monetary Authority continues to communicate with the public and effectively clarify false rumors related to financial and banking sector stability through social media.

# Public Query

The Public Inquiry Service is an effective channel for enhancing the public's understanding of the HKMA's main functions and operations. In 2020, a total of 9,514 enquiries were processed, with approximately half involving banking industry policies and regulations, banking consumer matters, banknotes and coins, financial infrastructure and bond market development, particularly the Coin Collection Programme, bank products and services, banking-related guidelines and announcements, the Retail Bond Issuance Programme, and currency and economic data.

Chart 1 shows the total number of public inquiries received each year since 2017, Chart 2 lists the proportion of various types of inquiries in 2020.

Chart 1: Total Public Queries

Chart 2: Breakdown of 2020 Inquiries Received by Nature

# publications

In addition to the HKMA's Annual Report, the HKMA published two issues of the "Half-Yearly Report on the Situation of Monetary and Financial Stability" and four issues of the "Quarterly Reports" during the year, and regularly updates the data from the "Monthly Financial Data Report," providing the latest and in-depth data and analysis on Hong Kong's monetary, banking, and economic affairs. In addition, the HKMA published a total of 18 "Exchange Thoughts" articles, introducing the HKMA's key measures and policies, and discussing issues of public concern.

Hong Kong Monetary Authority's 2019 Annual Report received the Silver Award in the "Non-profit and Charitable Institutions" category at the Hong Kong Institute of Management's 2020 Annual Best Annual Report Evaluation.

# Payments Bureau website

The Hong Kong Monetary Authority's official website (www.hkma.gov.hk) provides over 40,000 pages of information in English and Chinese versions in both simplified and traditional characters, facilitating the public's access to the latest information of the Hong Kong Monetary Authority. The website also contains the "Register of Licensed Institutions and Their Local Representatives' Offices" and "Register of Employees in Licensed Institutions' Securities Business" maintained in accordance with section 20 of the Banking Ordinance, as well as the "Register of Licensed Persons in Stored Value Facilities" maintained in accordance with the Payment Systems and Stored Value Facilities Ordinance.

The Hong Kong Monetary Authority has been phased in releasing financial data and key information on its website through open application programming interfaces (open APIs) since 2018. As of the end of 2020, the HKMA launched a total of 144 open API sets on the website as scheduled.

Payments actively supports the development and application of open API.

# Payments Authority Information Centre

The Hong Kong Monetary Authority's Information Centre is located on the 55th floor of the International Financial Centre Phase 2, introducing the public to the Monetary Authority's work and enhancing the public's understanding of currency and banking matters. The Information Centre is divided into two parts: the Exhibition Hall and the Library. The Exhibition Hall introduces the Monetary Authority's functions interactively, as well as the development of Hong Kong's currency and banking sector, and provides materials and exhibits for research on Hong Kong's currency, banking, and financial affairs. Adjacent to the Exhibition Hall is the Library, which houses over 26,000 books, journals, and other publications for research on topics such as Hong Kong's currency, banking, finance, and central banking matters. The Library also keeps the "Record Book of Authorized Institutions and Local Representatives" and the "Record Book of Employees in Authorized Institutions' Securities Business" stipulated under Section 20 of the Banking Ordinance.

The Hong Kong Monetary Authority's Information Centre, by virtue of its carefully designed and uniquely distinctive atmosphere, stood out among thousands of participants from around the globe and became one of the winners of the Platinum Award in the Interior Design category at the 2020 MUSE DESIGN AWARDS.

The Information Centre made use of the opportunity during the 2020 pandemic when the facility was temporarily suspended to optimize the "Policy" exhibition area's facilities. The exhibition area explains the Hong Kong Monetary Authority's work and introduces related financial concepts. The optimization measures were made in response to visitor feedback, making the interactive facilities easier to use, more engaging, and more durable, thus enhancing the visitor experience.

The interactive facilities in the "Policy" section of the Information Centre have completed the optimization project.

The exhibition hall part of the Information Centre introduces the work of the Hong Kong Monetary Authority and the development of Hong Kong's currency and banking industry.

To ensure that the public, regardless of race, can equally access the facilities of the information center, the center has established procedures to provide interpretation services for visitors who need them and individuals who call the center's hotline.

The Information Centre's operating hours and services have been affected by the ongoing pandemic. To ensure public safety and maintain a high standard of hygiene environment, the Information Centre implemented special arrangements and pandemic measures during the year, enhanced cleaning and disinfection, and facilities and exhibits are regularly disinfected using long-lasting antimicrobial coatings.

# Public and Consumer Education

To maintain contact with the community and enhance public understanding of the Hong Kong Monetary Authority's work, the HKMA held an online public education lecture in 2020, attracting over 1,600 students and teachers from 61 secondary schools. The lecture covered an introduction to the HKMA's work, the Linked Exchange Rate System, Hong Kong banknotes, protection of personal digital keys, and the deposit protection scheme. Since its launch in 1998, this public education lecture was first held online, and to date, has attracted over 61,000 students and teachers to participate.

More than 1,600 teachers and students from 61 secondary schools attended the Hong Kong Monetary Authority's online public education webinar.

The HKMA educates the public to be prudent and responsible financial service consumers and maintains communication with the public. One of the key focuses of the related educational work continues to be "Protection of personal digital keys." During the year, the HKMA produced a series of short videos urging citizens to properly safeguard their financial accounts and personal data at all times and places. Given the increase in online fraud cases during the pandemic caused by the novel coronavirus, the HKMA reminds citizens to increase vigilance when shopping online or using personal authentication data and to be cautious of scams.

To increase young people's interest in working for the HKMA, the HKMA launched the public education online drama series "STEPS" in 2020 and posted a series of related posts on social media, introducing the HKMA's work in areas such as currency, linked exchange rate system, fintech, financial inclusion, banking regulation, and international cooperation.

Public Education Online Drama Series "STEPS" uses a light-hearted manner through the growth story of a newly hired individual to introduce the main functions of the Monetary Authority.

The Hong Kong Monetary Authority has widely promoted information on the protection of personal digital keys through digital platforms and overseas media.

The HKMA also collaborated with various stakeholders through multiple community participation activities, one of which is the online parenting financial education activity "Little Financial Experts." Through animated videos, online games, DIY toys, downloadable worksheets, and coloring contests, it teaches kindergarten and primary school students basic concepts of money and finance, as well as fundamental knowledge about banks and payment services.

An animated film featuring mascot Dollar Pig and the Kam family as the main characters disseminates information on five themes.

Demonstrate DIY toys made from eco-friendly materials.

Other activities related to youth education include an online financial quiz competition, online educational talks designed for middle school students and teachers, collaboration with a professional group to produce a comic book targeting elementary students and parents, and online lectures hosted for university students.

The HKMA supports investors and the Financial Education Committee in enhancing the financial literacy knowledge and capabilities of Hong Kong citizens, and will study further collaboration with stakeholders to improve the effectiveness of community participation.

# Hong Kong Monetary Authority Employees

The HKMA is part of the government framework but hires employees under non-civil service terms to attract talent with appropriate experience and specialized knowledge. The HKMA recruits, trains, and maintains a professional and excellent work team to fulfill policy objectives and flexibly respond to changes in work requirements.

The Hong Kong Monetary Authority's staffing in 2020 was 1,005 persons. During the year, the Hong Kong Monetary Authority is committed to flexibly redeploying existing resources, enhancing efficiency, and less extensive work procedures to support the needs of new projects and increasingly complex work. The Hong Kong Monetary Authority's staffing in 2021 will maintain 1,005 persons and will redeploy existing resources to address the following newly initiated and expanded work:

# Stability of the Banking and Financial System
- Support policy development work for "Rational Finance Pass," as well as other measures related to the Hong Kong-Macao Greater Bay Area (GBA) and private wealth management, and sustained supervision of "Rational Finance Pass" business
- Handle licensing work under the Insurance Ordinance and the new over-the-counter derivatives regime, as well as conduct supervision work related to virtual banks
- Implement new regulatory requirements related to climate risks, and strengthen prudential supervision of banks

# Reserve Management - Strengthen investment, risk management, and other necessary support to support the Exchange Fund's sustained expansion and diversified investment activities.

# Hong Kong's International Financial Centre Status
- Provide support to strengthen participation in the Financial Stability Council and other international working groups
- Manage the recently recommended attached equity tax concession system, as well as verify funds that are eligible for tax concessions

Table 1 provides a breakdown by department of the Hong Kong Monetary Authority's position establishment and actual number of staff members.

Table 1: Position Establishment and Actual Number of Staff Members of the HKMA as of January 1, 2021

# Remuneration and Benefits Policy and Remuneration Review Mechanism

The Financial Secretary (FS) seeks the views of the governing committee under its governance through the Exchange Fund Advisory Committee, references market remuneration levels and practices, and determines the remuneration and service conditions for HKMA staff. The remuneration portfolio includes cash remuneration and a provident fund, plus some basic benefits. Cash remuneration comprises a monthly fixed salary (i.e., basic salary) and a variable salary paid annually based on staff performance.

The Financial Secretary reviews the remuneration of the Hong Kong Monetary Authority's staff annually, consulting the Exchange Fund Advisory Committee for their recommendations, and considers the governance committee's assessment of the Hong Kong Monetary Authority's performance over the past year, the survey results on financial industry remuneration conducted by an independent human resources consultancy company, and other relevant factors. Outstanding individuals with exceptional work performance may also receive special adjustments to reward them and maintain their remuneration competitiveness.

The HKMA allocates the approved funds for adjusting annual fixed and variable remuneration based on individual employees' work performance; the variable remuneration system applicable to employees responsible for investments aims to strengthen the link between their investment performance and remuneration. The adjustment of fixed remuneration and disbursement of variable remuneration for Assistant Deputy Directors and above are approved by the Financial Secretary, following consultation with the Governance Committee, and such employees will abstain from meetings discussing their remuneration proposals. The adjustment of fixed remuneration and disbursement of variable remuneration for Managers and below are decided by the HKMA Governor, based on the Financial Secretary's authorization, using the approved total amount for remuneration payments.

# 機構社會責任

金管局致力履行機構社會責任，以成為負責任及可持續發展的機構為目標。金管局在不同領域履行此承諾，包括推動可持續發展及具環保意識的市場、關懷廣大社會、保護環境及締造友善的工作環境。

為應對新冠病毒疫情，金管局推出多項措施，支援有需要的個人及企業，從而協助香港經濟渡過難關。

# 市場環境

# 綠色及可持續金融

氣候變化是影響人類福祉及全球經濟可持續性的主要風險之一，作為社會重要環節之一的金融體系，亦難免會受到影響；而銀行作為金融體系的一部分，應更積極管理氣候風險。有見及此，金管局致力探究應對這項挑戰的方法，並正落實多項於2019年5月宣布推出的措施，促進綠色金融在香港的發展。有關措施包括分三階段推動綠色及可持續銀行業的發展：

# 第一階段

與業界建立一個共同框架，評估銀行目前的「綠色基準」，以及與國際組織合作，為本港銀行提供技術支援；

# 第二階段

就綠色及可持續銀行業的監管期望及要求諮詢業界及其他持份者；以及

# 第三階段

集中落實、審視及評估銀行在這方面的進度。

在國際層面，金管局參與多個國際組織，包括央行與監管機構綠色金融網絡、巴塞爾銀行監管委員會轄下的氣候相關財務風險高級別工作組、東亞及太平洋地區中央銀行會議轄下銀行監管工作小組之下的可持續金融關注組及國際可持續金融平台。透過參與這些國際組織，金管局有機會為中央銀行界及監管機構在應對氣候變化的工作上作出貢獻，並能在制定本地架構時借鑑其他地區的經驗與觀點。

金管局亦參與央行與監管機構綠色金融網絡下的多個工作組，包括微觀審慎監管工作組、宏觀金融工作組及促進綠色金融工作組。此外，金管局亦加入了兩個新設的工作組：研究工作組及彌補數據缺口工作組。研究工作組負責相關研究工作，而彌補數據缺口工作組旨在制定監管當局及金融機構評估氣候相關風險與機遇所需、但目前卻並未掌握的數據項目詳盡清單。有關金管局年內在推動綠色及可持續銀行業發展方面的工作，詳見「銀行體系穩定」一章。

金管局在11月與國際金融公司聯合推出綠色商業銀行聯盟，協助各新興市場的銀行制定應對氣候變化的方案。作為聯盟的創始成員及首個區域執行理事，金管局i)在全球金融市場推動發展綠色商業銀行；ii)為商業銀行提供互相學習平台，獲取所需知識、工具及商業資訊，以制定其本身的綠色金融路線圖，並轉型為具公信力的綠色銀行；iii)促進溝通，並探討前沿議題推動全球綠色議程；以及iv)協助聯盟的成員合作，以及把握國際金融公司所識別在未來10年估計高達23萬億美元的新興市場綠色及氣候相關投資機會。

本地方面，金管局與其他金融監管機構合作，協調金融業針對氣候和環境風險的措施應對。除了協助政府落實政府綠色債券計劃的相關工作外，金管局亦與證券及期貨事務監察委員會（證監會）共同發起成立了綠色和可持續金融跨機構督導小組（督導小組），處理跨行業的監管及市場發展事宜。有關金管局年內在發展香港成為綠色及可持續金融樞紐方面的工作，詳見「香港的國際金融中心地位」一章。

# 綠色和可持續金融跨機構督導小組

督導小組旨在協調金融業針對氣候及環境風險的措施應對、加快香港綠色及可持續金融的發展，以及支持政府的氣候策略。督導小組由金管局與證監會於5月共同發起成立，其他成員包括環境局、財經事務及庫務局、香港交易及結算所有限公司、保險業監管局及強制性公積金計劃管理局。

自成立以來，督導小組設立了兩個技術工作專責團隊，分別負責研究及處理跨部門的監管事宜，以及協調跨機構的市場發展工作。

督導小組在12月發布綠色及可持續金融策略，提出從六方面鞏固香港金融生態系統，長遠共建更綠色及更可持續的未來。督導小組亦宣布5個短期行動綱領，處理發展過程中一些最迫切的問題。

金管局舉辦督導小組成立大會，金管局總裁余偉文先生（右三）為該小組的聯席主席。

督導小組發布香港的綠色和可持續金融策略計劃及5個主要行動綱領。

# 負責任投資

金管局支持負責任投資，即將環境、社會及管治(ESG)因素融入投資活動中。金管局作為規模龐大的資產擁有人，日益關注負責任投資，將對其基金經理如何進行投資活動產生影響。

# 金管局的信念

金管局相信透過適度強調負責任投資及考慮各項投資的可持續長期表現，將更有效達致外匯基金的投資目標，並且減低投資活動所涉及的ESG相關風險。

# 金管局的原則

按金管局採取的指導性原則，當ESG投資與其他投資項目的經風險調整長期收益相若時，一般會優先考慮ESG投資。作為負責任的長期投資者，金管局在投資管理過程中，會因應情況採納以下的負責任投資原則：

# 融入

金管局相信ESG因素會對投資項目的長期價值帶來重大影響，因此將ESG因素融入投資分析程序，以辨察風險及物色良機。金管局將ESG因素併入公開市場及私募市場的投資管理過程中。

# 主動行使資產擁有權

金管局就所持有的上市公司股票適當地行使股東權利，以維護投資的長期價值。金管局相信，顧及ESG因素的負責任企業行為，將有助創造長綫的股東利益。金管局期望外聘投資經理透過行使表決權及與獲投資公司溝通時，主動行使資產擁有權，藉以協助金管局履行對投資項目的擁有權責任。

# 合作

金管局致力與理念相近的投資者及監管機構合作，推動良好的長期投資管理手法，又出席公開活動並發表演講，分享更完善的ESG作業手法及鼓勵投資界採納負責任投資理念。

有關金管局年內在負責任投資方面的工作，詳見「儲備管理」一章。

# 金管局作為主動的負責任投資者，監察外聘投資經理的ESG作業手法

# 金管局的期望

金管局非常重視將ESG因素融入投資決定及主動行使資產擁有權等概念。為此，金管局在甄選聘任及監察外聘投資經理時，皆會考慮ESG因素。由於金管局認為就所持有的上市公司股票行使股東權利，是維護投資的長期價值的基本方針，因此會要求獲聘任的投資經理嚴肅對待主動行使資產擁有權一事。

# 金管局的監察

外聘投資經理須就其替金管局管理的上市股票組合的ESG表現接受評估。金管局透過溝通計劃，有系統地檢視外聘投資經理在不同範疇的ESG作業手法，例如其ESG評估架構、與獲投資公司的溝通，以及代理投票方面的工作。金管局在2020年選出若干外聘投資經理率先進行溝通計劃，當中不僅評估其ESG表現，亦檢視其有否代表金管局妥善行使資產擁有權。

# 溝通成果

金管局透過計劃識別出作業手法有問題的外聘投資經理，並採取跟進行動。下文列舉其中兩個例子。

# 個案1

金管局留意到股票投資經理A的ESG架構有改善空間，尤其應設立更有系統的方法去評估獲投資公司。金管局就此與A跟進，其後A進行全面的公司政策檢討，以實施一個更穩健的ESG架構。A更特別委任外聘顧問就ESG程序提供意見，反映加快落實改革的決心，並新設由高級管理層組成的ESG委員會，顯示對ESG的承擔及高級管理層對有關措施的支持。

# 個案2

金管局在檢視股票投資經理B的投票方法後，發現B的投票政策在多個範疇上都有不足之處，並要求其ESG主管作出審視。尤其B在過往的投票全數贊成管理層的建議，偏離其本身的代理投票指引。B其後承諾會加強公司的投票政策以符合期望，其中包括會提高ESG團隊成員的參與度，以及在遇上涉及重大管治問題時有可能對管理層投下反對票。

在私募市場投資方面，金管局藉着其專責合夥人致力與相關投資組合公司在ESG事宜上合作，從而實現負責任投資。金管局留意到專責合夥人都貫徹對ESG的承擔，因他們認為此舉可有利創造投資組合公司的長期價值和確保回報的可持續性。下文列舉的兩個例子顯示可透過(i)設計改動及利用創新運作技術；以及(ii)在建造及營運綠色及可持續倉庫時融入減碳因素，以管理氣候變化風險。兩個例子都對環境產生顯著的正面影響，減少碳排放，避免有害物質，並同時透過降低成本及節省能源，提升運作效率。

(i) 金管局有投資一間採用環保方案的害蟲防治公司。雖然傳統殺蟲劑及化學製品能有效殺滅害蟲，但若未能迅速清除或妥善棄置蟲屍，將會危害公共衛生。此外，化學成分的滲漏及棄置亦會造成環境問題。該公司採用的不含生物殺滅劑方案，透過設置捕蟲器以減少使用有害化學品。該公司亦利用與互聯網相連的動態感應器，遙距偵察是否已捕獲害蟲。藉着此項新技術，該公司能作出完善的路線規劃以收集捕獲的害蟲，減低出行里程，從而減少碳排放。該公司採用的方案令公司整體碳排的淨效應達到每美元淨銷售額0.36千克二氧化碳當量的低水平，接近法律服務及軟件出版等低碳行業的平均水平，實在令人鼓舞。

(ii) 金管局有投資綠色及可持續倉庫。雖然建造業是碳排放的一大源頭，但有關的倉庫發展商在其整體倉庫建造與營運中，採用淨零碳排放程序，並制定衡量淨零碳排放基準的標準及指標，而建築計劃亦顧及所用材料與部件的可持續性。因此，所建造的倉庫減碳效率高，並具備可持續特點，包括太陽能加熱系統、電動車充電設施、自然採光及雨水收集等。

根據獨立顧問的評估，按淨額計，有關倉庫建造的碳足跡較一般物流大廈的碳排放量低25.8%。為進一步抵銷建築工程所造成的碳排放，建造過程中更種植了32,799棵樹（以淨額計）。建成後倉庫的日常運作的碳排放量較一般倉庫少26.9%。
